fields.label: spfrecordcount
fields.name: Single SPF Exists
fields.description: This test verifies if more than one SPF records exists for your domain.
fields.message_failed: More than one (1) SPF record is defined for your domain.
fields.message_partial: More than one (1) SPF record is defined for your domain.
fields.message_success: A single SPF record is defined for your domain.
fields.message_na: The result of this test is not available.

fields.label: spfsyntaxisvalid
fields.name: SPF Record Syntax
fields.description: This test validate the syntax of your SPF record.
fields.message_failed: The syntax of your SPF record is invalid.
fields.message_partial: Minor issues were found in the syntax of your SPF record.
fields.message_success: The syntax of your SPF record is valid.

fields.label: spfrecordnottoopermissive
fields.name: SPF Record Policy
fields.description: Verifies if the record restricts usage of the domain by using the proper qualifier for 'all'.
fields.message_failed: Your SPF record prevents unrestricted use of the domain.
fields.message_partial: Your SPF record is too permissive.
fields.message_success: Your SPF record is too permissive.

fields.label: spfvalidlookupcount
fields.name: SPF Valid Lookup Count
fields.description: This test verifies that the number of lookup mechanisms does not exceed 10.
fields.message_failed: The SPF records uses more than ten (10) lookup mechanisms.
fields.message_success: The SPF records uses less than ten (10) lookup mechanisms.

fields.label: spfvoidlookupscount
fields.name: Void Lookups Count
fields.description: Verifies if the count of void lookups is below or equal to 2.
fields.message_failed: The count of void lookups is greater than 2.
fields.message_success: The count of void lookups is below or equal to 2.

fields.label: spfrecordnotdeprecatedcheck
fields.name: Not using deprecated SPF records
fields.description: This test verifies the SPF records uses a deprecated record type.
fields.message_failed: Update your SPF record to use TXT records instead of SPF records.
fields.message_success: Your SPF record is using the the proper TXT record type.

fields.label: spfrecorddontuseptr
fields.name: Avoidance of the PTR Mechanism
fields.description: Verifies if the record makes use of the PTR mechanism.
fields.message_failed: The record uses the PTR mechanism.
fields.message_success: The record does not use the PTR mechanism.

fields.label: spfrecordexpectedterminator
fields.name: Standard SPF Record Termination
fields.description: Confirms that the record ends with the 'all' mechanism.
fields.message_failed: Some data was found following the 'all' mechanism.
fields.message_partial: Some data was found following the 'all' mechanism.
fields.message_success: There is no trailing data after the 'all' mechanism.

fields.label: dkimrecordsexisttest
fields.name: DKIM Record
fields.description: Attempts to confirm the existence of one or more DKIM records.
fields.message_failed: There is no indication that DKIM records exist for the given domain.
fields.message_success: DKIM records are supported for your domain.

fields.label: dmarcrecordcounttest
fields.name: DMARC Record
fields.description: Verifies if one or more DMARC records exists for a specific domain.
fields.message_failed: No DMARC record was found.
fields.message_partial: Multiple DMARC records were found for a single domain.
fields.message_success: A DMARC record was found for your domain.

fields.label: dmarcsyntaxisvalid
fields.name: DMARC Record Syntax
fields.description: Verifies if the syntax of the DMARC record is valid.
fields.message_failed: The syntax of yourDMARC record is invalid.
fields.message_partial: Minor issues were detected with your DMARC record.
fields.message_success: The syntax of your DMARC record is valid.

fields.label: dmarcexternalreportstest
fields.name: DMARC External Reporting
fields.description: If you want to send your DMARC reports to a domain other than the one that the record is for, then the receiving domain needs to configure a DNS record so that Email Service Providers know that the recipient is authorizing the the reports.
fields.message_failed: The destination domain is not setup to receive your reports.
fields.message_success: The destination domain has the proper TXT record to receive domains.

fields.label: dnskeyandrrsigrecordsexists
fields.name: DNSSEC Records
fields.description: Verifies if a DNSKEY and RRSIG records exist for the domain.
fields.message_failed: No DNSKEY and RRSIG records or invalid records were returned.
fields.message_success: Your domain returned DNSKEY and RRSIG records.

fields.label: dnssecrecordisvalid
fields.name: DNSSEC Validation
fields.description: Verifies if the DNSSEC record is valid.
fields.message_failed: The DNSSEC record failed validation.
fields.message_success: The DNSSEC record has validated successfully.

fields.label: dmarcpolicyisnotnone
fields.name: DMARC Policy
fields.description: Verifies if the DMARC policy is set to none.
fields.message_failed: The DMARC policy is set to none. No message is filtered.
fields.message_partial: Your DMARC policy could be set to a more strict policy.
fields.message_success: The DMARC policy is configure to quarantine or reject invalid emails.

fields.label: dmarcpctis100
fields.name: DMARC Full Reporting
fields.description: Verifies what percentage of emails are being filtered.
fields.message_failed: No emails are being validated by your DMARC installation.
fields.message_partial: Not all emails are being authenticated via DMARC.
fields.message_success: All emails are being vetted by DMARC.

fields.label: dmarcruaisset
fields.name: DMARC Aggregate Reporting
fields.description: Checks if an email address has been set for DMARC aggregate reporting.
fields.message_failed: You are not receiving aggregate reports from your DMARC setup.
fields.message_partial: The email set to receive aggregate reports is invalid.
fields.message_success: You are receiving aggregate reports for your domain.

fields.label: dmarcrufisset
fields.name: DMARC Forensics Reporting
fields.description: Checks if an email address have been set for DMARC forensics reporting.
fields.message_failed: You are not receiving forensics reports for your domain.
fields.message_partial: The email address for receiving forensics reports is invalid.
fields.message_success: You are receiving forensics reports for your domain.

fields.label: httpsenabledtest
fields.name: Secure Web Communications
fields.description: Verifies if HTTPS is enabled for the website linked to the domain.
fields.message_failed: Unable to connect to the website via HTTPS.
fields.message_success: A successful connection to the website was established using secure HTTP.

fields.label: hstsenabledtest
fields.name: HTTP Strict-Transport-Security Header
fields.description: Verifies if the Strict-Transport-Security mechanism is enabled.
fields.message_failed: A HSTS header was not provided by the server.
fields.message_success: A HSTS header was provided from the server.

fields.label: httpscertificateisvalid
fields.name: SSL Certificate Validation
fields.description: Validates the SSL certificate for the web server.
fields.message_failed: The certificate is invalid.
fields.message_success: The certificate is valid.

fields.label: httpscertificatecipherstrength
fields.name: Cipher Suites
fields.description: Tests to confirm that the website is using a strong and modern cipher.
fields.message_failed: Your webserver is advertising weak encryption protocols.
fields.message_success: The HTTPS server is using strong and modern encryption.

fields.label: automatichttpsredirection
fields.name: Automatic Redirection to Secure Website
fields.description: Verifies if a request to the unsecure version of a website redirects to HTTPS.
fields.message_failed: The request was not redirected to the HTTPS version.
fields.message_success: Request is redirected to the HTTPS version.

fields.label: smtpserverfoundtest
fields.name: Mail Servers
fields.description: Checks if the application was able to find to at least one SMTP server.
fields.message_failed: No SMTP server was found based on the given domain.
fields.message_success: One or more SMTP server(s) were found.

fields.label: smtpcertificatecn
fields.name: Certificate Common Name
fields.description: This test verifies if your certificate appears legitimate to outside agents by having it signed for your mail servers only.
fields.message_failed: The certificate is invalid.
fields.message_success: The certificate is valid.

fields.label: smtpprotocols
fields.name: TLS Version
fields.description: Verifies if the server(s) offer secure versions of the TLS protocol.
fields.message_failed: All servers only support weak TLS versions.
fields.message_partial: One or more servers provided support for weaker TLS versions.
fields.message_success: All servers support only TLS v1.0 or higher only.

fields.label: smtpciphers
fields.name: SSL Cipher Suite
fields.description: This verifies the certificate used to encrypt SMTP traffic is legitimate by confirming the name and domain of the certificate.
fields.message_failed: The certificate is invalid.
fields.message_success: The certificate is valid.

fields.label: smtpstarttlsisenabled
fields.name: STARTTLS Support
fields.description: Verifies if STARTTLS is enabled on the remote SMTP server.
fields.message_failed: STARTLS is disabled on the remote SMTP server.
fields.message_success: STARTTLS is enabled on the remote SMTP server.

fields.label: smtpisclosedrelay
fields.name: Closed Relay
fields.description: Verifies if the SMTP server acts as open-relay.
fields.message_failed: Your SMTP server(s) can be used by malicious actors for spoofing purposes.
fields.message_success: Your SMTP server(s) cannot be used to relay spam and phishing emails.

fields.label: xframeoptionheadertest
fields.name: X-Frame-Options Header
fields.description: Verifies if the X-Frame-Options header is defined in responses from the web server.
fields.message_failed: The X-Frame-Options header is not sent by the server.
fields.message_partial: The X-Frame-Options header is returnedbut is not properly configured.
fields.message_success: The X-Frame-Options header is returned and is properly configured.

fields.label: xxssprotectionheadertest
fields.name: X-XSS-Protection Header
fields.description: Verifies if the X-XSS-Protection header is properly defined in responses from the web server.
fields.message_failed: The X-XSS-Protection header was not sent by the server.
fields.message_partial: The X-XSS-Protection header is returned but is not properly configured.
fields.message_success: The X-XSS-Protection header is returned and is properly configured.

fields.label: xcontenttypeoptionsheadertest
fields.name: X-Content-Type-Options Header
fields.description: Verifies if the X-Content-Type-Options header is properly defined in responses from the web server.
fields.message_failed: The X-Content-Type-Options header is not sent by the server.
fields.message_partial: The X-Content-Type-Options header is returned but is not properly configured.
fields.message_success: The X-Content-Type-Options header is returned and is properly configured.

fields.label: contentsecurityheadertest
fields.name: Content Security Policy Header
fields.description: Verifies if the Content Security Policy header is properly defined in responses from the web server.
fields.message_failed: The Content Security Policy (CSP) was not sent by the server.
fields.message_partial: The Content Security Policy header is returned but is not properly configured.
fields.message_success: The Content Security Policy header is returned and is properly configured.

fields.label: referrerpolicyheadertest
fields.name: Referrer-Policy Header
fields.description: Verifies if the Referrer-Policy header is properly defined in responses from the web server.
fields.message_failed: The Referrer-Policy header is not sent by the server.
fields.message_partial: The Referrer-Policy header is returned but is not properly configured.
fields.message_success: The Referrer-Policy header is returned and is properly configured.

fields.label: serverheadertest
fields.name: Server Header
fields.description: Verifies if the Server header is returned by the server.
fields.message_failed: The Server header is sent by the server.
fields.message_partial: The Server header is sent by the server.
fields.message_success: The Server header is not returned by the server.
fields.message_na: No result available for this test.

fields.label: xpoweredbyheadertest
fields.name: X-Powered-By Header
fields.description: Verifies if the X-Powered-By header is returned by the server.
fields.message_failed: The X-Powered-By header is returned and contains product and information data.
fields.message_partial: The X-Powered-By header is returned and contains product information, but no version data was found.
fields.message_success: The X-Powered-By header is not returned by the server.

fields.label: featurepolicyheadertest
fields.name: Feature-Policy Header
fields.description: Verifies if the Feature-Policy header is returned by the server.
fields.message_failed: The Feature-Policy header was not returned by the server.
fields.message_partial: The Feature-Policy header is returned, but appears to be misconfigured.
fields.message_success: The Feature-Policy header is returned by the server.

fields.label: cookiesyntaxisvalid
fields.name: Cookie Syntax
fields.description: Verifies the lexical syntax of a cookie.
fields.message_failed: None of the cookie found has a valid syntax.
fields.message_partial: At least one cookie had an invalid syntax.
fields.message_success: All cookies found had a valid syntax.

fields.label: httpcookienoprefix
fields.name: Unsecure Cookies Prefix
fields.description: Confirms that HTTP cookies sent via unsecure HTTP do no use secure prefixes.
fields.message_failed: All cookies sent via unsecure HTTP uses a secure prefix.
fields.message_partial: At least one cookie sent via unsecure HTTP uses a secure prefix.
fields.message_success: None of the cookies sent via unsecure HTTP are prefixed.

fields.label: httpcookiehttponly
fields.name: Usage of HttpOnly Flag
fields.description: Confirms that cookies sent via unsecure HTTP have the 'HttpOnly' flag set.
fields.message_failed: None of the cookies found had the 'HttpOnly' flag.
fields.message_partial: At least one cookie did not have the 'HttpOnly' flag.
fields.message_success: All of the cookies sent via HTTP uses the 'HttpOnly'.

fields.label: httpcookieisnotsecure
fields.name: Improper use of the 'Secure' Flag
fields.description: Verifies that none of the cookies sent via unsecure HTTP has the 'Secure' flag set.
fields.message_failed: All of the cookies sent via unsecure HTTP had the 'Secure' flag enabled.
fields.message_partial: At least one cookie sent via unsecure HTTP had the 'Secure' flag enabled.
fields.message_success: None of the cookies sent via unsecure HTTP had the 'Secure' flag enabled.

fields.label: cookiesamesite
fields.name: Usage of the 'SameSite' Flag
fields.description: Verifies if cookies are set with the Samesite flag.
fields.message_failed: At least one cookie did not have the 'SameSite' flag set.
fields.message_partial: All cookies had the SameSite flag set at least to 'lax'.
fields.message_success: All cookies had the SameSite flag set to strict.

fields.label: httpscookieissecure
fields.name: Usage of the 'Secure' Flag for Secure Cookies
fields.description: Verifies that all cookies sent via encrypted HTTP has the 'Secure' flag set.
fields.message_failed: None of the cookies sent via secure HTTP had the 'Secure' flag enabled.
fields.message_partial: At least one cookie sent via secure HTTP did not have the 'Secure' flag enabled.
fields.message_success: All of the cookies sent via secure HTTP had the 'Secure' flag enabled.

fields.label: httpscookiehostprefixisvalid
fields.name: Usage of the '__Host' Prefix
fields.description: Verifies that all cookies enforces usage of the '__Host' prefix.
fields.message_failed: None of the cookies sent via secure HTTP had the '__Host' prefix.
fields.message_partial: At least one cookie sent via secure HTTP did not have the '__Host' prefix.
fields.message_success: All of the cookies sent via secure HTTP had the '__Host' prefix.

fields.label: httpscookiesecureprefixisvalid
fields.name: Usage of the '__Secure' Prefix
fields.description: Verifies that all cookies enforces usage of the '__Secure' prefix.
fields.message_failed: At least one cookie prefixed with '__Secure-' does not have the 'secure' flag.
fields.message_partial: At least one cookie prefixed with '__Secure-' does not have the 'secure' flag.
fields.message_success: All cookies prefixed with '__Secure-' do not have the 'secure' flag.

fields.label: nocookietest
fields.name: Website is Using Cookies
fields.description: Verifies if the target website sends one or more cookies.
fields.message_failed: The target website sent one or more cookies.
fields.message_partial: The target website is not sending any cookies.
fields.message_success: The target website is not sending any cookies.

fields.label: ipblocklist
fields.name: Malicious Activity from IP
fields.description: Verifies if IP addresses relating to the domain are blacklisted.
fields.message_failed: Your IP address(es) are listed on one or more blacklists.
fields.message_success: Your IP address(es) are not listed on any blacklist.

fields.label: hostreputation
fields.name: Unsolicited Communications
fields.description: Verifies if IP addresses relating to the domain are blacklisted.
fields.message_failed: Your host has been associated with malicious activities.
fields.message_success: Your host has not been associated with malicious activities.

fields.label: hosthaspotentialvulnerabilities
fields.name: Potential Vulnerabilities Detected
fields.description: Verifies if the host exposes potentially vulnerable services.
fields.message_failed: One of more hosts may expose many services with known vulnerabilities.
fields.message_partial: Some vulnerabilities were potentially identified.
fields.message_success: No known vulnerability has been found for your host.

fields.label: hostopenports
fields.name: Open Ports
fields.description: Enumerates ports opened on the target host.
fields.message_failed: A large number of services are exposed to the Internet.
fields.message_success: No or few ports are exposed to the Internet.

fields.label: emailleaks
fields.name: Emails Leaked Online
fields.description: Searches for email relating to a given domain from public data leaks.
fields.message_failed: Your domain was found at least once in known, public data leaks.
fields.message_success: Your domain was not found in any known public leaks.
